Ad Text:
Company Description

SGS Australia is a leading provider of Testing, Inspection, and Certification services, supporting multiple industries across the country with trusted expertise and technical excellence. Backed by SGS’s global legacy of over 140 years, we operate one of the largest networks of accredited laboratories and field facilities in Australia, with a network of more than 50 offices and laboratories and over 1,400 employees across Australia. We are accredited by NATA and ISO 9001, ensuring our services meet both Australian and international standards.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our Perth team. This role will play a pivotal part in designing and driving integration strategies across business functions, ensuring smooth alignment between entities during mergers and acquisitions.

Key Responsibilities include however not limited to:

Partner with the management team to design and implement integration strategies.

Develop and manage detailed integration project plans, timelines, and deliverables.

Coordinate with HR, IT, Finance, and Operations to align resources and activities.

Gain a strong understanding of both SGS and acquired entity’s business and functional areas.

Engage senior leadership, managers, and employees through regular updates to maintain transparency.

Address cultural and organizational differences to support smooth collaboration.

Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies.

Lead collaboration across Finance, Procurement, HR, and Business Analytics to integrate key systems, including:

           Financial reporting systems for group analysis and reporting

            PBI reporting tools

Use project management tools and metrics to monitor milestones and adjust plans.

Prepare and present integration status reports to senior leadership.

Analyze financial and operational data to identify improvement opportunities.

Track and report on synergies, value creation, and business case delivery.

Oversee month-end close processes, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.

Skills, Knowlege and Experiences

The ideal candidate will have a:

Degree in Business Management, Accounting, or relevant discipline.

Chartered Accountant (CA) or Certified Practising Accountant (CPA) preferred.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in M&A integration or a related field.

Proven track record of managing complex integration projects.

Strong project management and change management skills.

Comprehensive understanding of finance practices and processes.

Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively with diverse teams.

Additional information

WHY WORK FOR SGS?

Working at SGS means joining an innovative, Global company. Here are some of the benefits to working for SGS. 

•    As a company, we have embraced the shift to flexible work
•    Sustainability is embedded in our culture and the way we do business
•    Paid parental leave
•    Paid time for volunteering day and blood donations
•    Corporate health & wellbeing offers
•    Ongoing learning & development 
•    Career development opportunities (Nationally and Globally)
•    SGS Rewards: Our employee benefits platform with access to retail and online discounts and cashback

COME TO WORK AND BE 100% YOU
SGS Australia supports a diverse workforce, we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability. Providing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is an important part of our SGS Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP). We truly believe the diversity among us will continue to foster a strong, innovative, and forward-thinking workplace.
SGS Australia acknowledges and pays respect to the past, present and future Traditional Custodians and Elders of this nation and the continuation of cultural, spiritual, and educational practices of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Lead strategic insights for business impact
Sydney/Brisbane/Perth CBD location, hybrid working with flexible leave options
Career growth in a purpose-led analytics team
Permanent role

About the role:

Turn data into decisions that matter. Join a collaborative analytics team driving performance across Workers Compensation and Commercial lines. As an Insights Business Partner, you’ll deliver performance intelligence that supports strategic decisions across Commercial & Personal Injury. You’ll work closely with senior leaders to uncover trends, risks, and opportunities that improve outcomes.

What you’ll do:

Deliver insights that guide strategic and operational decisions
Partner with senior leaders to analyse performance and drive improvement
Present trends and recommendations in monthly performance reviews
Provide ad-hoc analysis to support key business decisions
Build trusted relationships across C&PI and supporting teams
Identify emerging trends and recommend actions for improvement

What you’ll bring:

Minimum 5 years in performance analytics or decision-making roles
Strong stakeholder engagement and influencing skills
Proficiency in tools like SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Excel
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights
Experience in Workers Compensation or insurance is a plus
A mindset for continuous improvement and innovation

What you’ll enjoy:

Access our award-winning Shine platform – your central hub for exclusive perks, wellbeing support, career development, and recognition.

Hybrid working, flexible leave, 20 weeks paid parental leave
Paid study support, career breaks, and referral bonuses
Wellbeing coaching, Employee Council, and EAP access
Discounts at 400+ retailers, insurance savings, and gym memberships
Paid volunteer leave, donation matching, and emergency response leave
Performance-based bonuses and Suncorp shares
Inclusive policies and employee resource groups

Explore our full benefits: www.suncorpgroup.com.au/careers/benefits

At Suncorp, we’re committed to creating a diverse, accessible, and inclusive culture. If you need more information, support or adjustments during the recruitment process or in the workplace, please contact annette_frasca@suncorp.com.au for a confidential conversation.

We are partnering with a leading insurance group undertaking one of the largest finance transformation programs in the market. This multi-year initiative is reshaping the organisation’s finance, reporting, and controls landscape, underpinned by new systems and process design.

We are seeking a Finance Process & UAT specialist to play a critical role in supporting finance workstreams across process re-design, testing and business readiness.

Key Responsibilities:
Partner with Finance SMEs and project teams to map and document end-to-end finance processes.
Conduct process analysis to identify impacts, risks and improvement opportunities.
Support User System Acceptance Testing (UAT) activities, including test planning, execution, issue tracking and resolution.
Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to ensure requirements are clearly defined and embedded into design and testing outcomes.
Provide high-quality reporting and updates to Finance Transformation leadership.
Contribute to business readiness and change activities to ensure smooth adoption of new processes and systems.
Skills & Experience
CPA/CA qualified or equivalent finance background.
Strong experience in finance process design and documentation.
Hands-on experience with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) within large system or ERP transformations.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills, with the ability to liaise across Finance, IT and project teams.
Prior experience in large-scale transformation within insurance or financial services highly regarded.
What’s on Offer
High-profile transformation program with a leading insurance group.
Initial 6 month contract opportunity with potential to extend.
Hybrid working environment with CBD office presence.
Chance to influence finance processes and systems that will shape the organisation’s future.
If you are a finance professional with transformation and UAT experience and enjoy working in complex, fast-paced environments, we’d love to hear from you.

Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Other (Education & Training)
Ad Text:
Vacancy Number: 143

Position Title: SMS Business and Reporting Specialist

Employment Status: Fixed Term Contract (1 January 2026 - 28 August 2026)

Department: ED People and Student Success

Location: Preston

Award Classification: Melbourne Polytechnic Academic Professional Staff Agreement

Salary: $140,000 - $150,000 per annum plus superannuation

Hours per Week: 38

Applications Close: Sunday 19 October 2025




Why Join Us

Melbourne Polytechnic has been a leader in practical, real-world education since 1912. We offer:

Industry-led, hands-on training

Inclusive, future-focused environments

A strong commitment to staff wellbeing

A culture built on curiosity, collaboration, and care




About the Role

Melbourne Polytechnic is seeking a dynamic SMS Business and Reporting Specialist to support the effective delivery of reporting strategy and automation for the new Student Management System (SMS). This is a great opportunity to contribute to strategic projects, drive operational improvements, and support collaborative team success in a purpose-driven environment.




Key Responsibilities

Lead and manage the reporting work stream deliverables for the SMS implementation project

Develop and implement a comprehensive reporting strategy

Reconcile and catalogue all operational and management reporting requirements

Deliver detailed reporting specifications, including prototype reports and dashboards

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop and test reports

Provide documentation, training, and post-go-live support

Contribute to project planning, data migration, testing, and change management




Skills and Experience Required

Tertiary qualifications in Project Management, Business, IT, or equivalent experience

Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills

Extensive knowledge of SMS and CRM capabilities in the education sector

Proven experience in delivering complex projects on time and within budget

Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools

Analytical mindset with strong organisational skills and attention to detail

Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing priorities




Additional Requirements

Successful candidate will be required to provide:

A valid Victorian Employee Working with Children Check (WWCC)

A National Police Check

How to Apply

Click Apply to submit your application through Melbourne Polytechnic’s careers portal. There, you will be able to view the full Position Description and upload your documents.

Please:

Complete all pre-screening questions

Upload your CV and a brief cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how your skills, experience, and personal attributes align with the Key Skills and Experience in the PD

If applying for a teaching role, upload combined copies of your relevant qualifications and provide your USI VET Transcript (if available):

Include the transcript link (from your USI Student Portal) in your coverletter, and upload the transcript PDF under thequalifications section

File Requirements:

Each file must be under 2MB. PDF is preferred (Word .doc or .docx also accepted). Avoid special characters in filenames (e.g., ! @ # % *).

Selection Process

Our process includes:

An interview (in-person or via Microsoft Teams)

Reference checks

Employment and qualification verification

Questions?

Contact: Recruitment Team

Email: recruitment@melbournepolytechnic.edu.au

Diversity and Inclusion

Melbourne Polytechnic is an equal opportunity and child-safe employer. We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with a disability, people from diverse cultural backgrounds and gender identities.




Recruitment Agencies

Melbourne Polytechnic manages all recruitment directly. We do not accept unsolicited applications from agencies unless engaged through the State Purchasing Contract and with prior written approval.

Step into an exhilarating journey with Velocity Frequent Flyer Virgin Australia’s award-winning loyalty program with over 13 million Members and counting. We make rewards fast and meaningful — from dream holidays and upgrades to retail, fuel, and everyday perks.

Velocity is all about smart, simple, and speedy rewards. As part of our vibrant team, you’ll help deliver unforgettable value to millions of Australians — all while enjoying the perks of working for one of the country’s most loved travel brands.

 

As the Loyalty Strategy Specialist, you’ll help shape the future of Velocity Frequent Flyer by designing and delivering strategies that bring our Member Value Proposition to life. Working closely with senior leaders, you’ll use insights, data, and market intelligence to create innovative and compelling propositions that deepen Member engagement and drive long-term growth.

If you’re a strategic thinker with a passion for Member centricity and creating customer-first propositions that deliver commercial impact, this role will give you the platform to make a real difference.

 

In addition, you will:  

Translate business strategy into Member-focused propositions that drive engagement, retention, and lifetime value.
Apply design thinking principles to uncover unmet needs and shape differentiated loyalty experiences.
Use data, analytics, and Member feedback to uncover opportunities and shape innovative loyalty offerings.
Build and deliver business cases that demonstrate clear value for both Members and the business.
Collaborate with Commercial, Digital, and Technology teams to deliver compelling member and program propositions.  
Contribute to loyalty innovation projects, exploring new ways to reward and engage Members.
Provide insights and recommendations to senior leadership, influencing investment and direction.
Support cross-functional programs that deliver personalised, rewarding Member journeys.
Stay across competitor and market trends to ensure Velocity remains differentiated and ahead of the curve.
ds to ensure Velocity remains differentiated and ahead of the curve.

 

You’ll be great in this role if you:

A degree in Business, Commerce, Marketing, or a related field.
3–5 years’ experience in strategy, consulting, customer experience, or loyalty.
A track record of delivering insights-led strategies that improved customer or Member outcomes.
Strong analytical skills, with experience in frameworks like CLV, NPS, CVP development, or segmentation.
Commercial acumen with the ability to link Member initiatives to measurable business value.
A collaborative, innovative mindset with the confidence to influence senior stakeholders.
Experience in loyalty or aviation (desirable but not essential).

 

What you’ll get from us:

We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):

Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)
Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide
Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge Membership
Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts
Wellness support, including the Converge digital wellbeing platform
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life – physical, mental, social and financial
Dress for Your Day – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you

 

Equality rules:

We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQIA+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family. 

Ready to apply? We’re ready to hear from you. Apply now.

The Company

The organisation is a private credit institution undergoing digital and operational transformation.

The Role

You will play a key role in shaping and delivering business and technology initiatives, including process optimisation, system enhancements and considerable uplift in the organisations lending platform.

Your Profile

- Experience as a business analyst in financial services

- Strong ability to analyse complex business problems and develop effective solutions

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels

- Proficiency in business analysis and project management tools and methodologies

Apply Today

Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button.

Newly created job for a Business Analyst with expertise in the Superannuation industry.

The project you will be working on will be focused on data integrity and remediation.

This role blends deep analytical capability with technical skills and project leadership to ensure the Fund delivers accurate member-focussed outcomes, with the Business Analyst responsible for interrogating problem spaces, documenting findings and deliver project outcomes in line with regulatory requirements, member expectations, and our organisational strategy.

Skill set / Experience needed -

Proven background working as a Business Analyst in the Superannuation domain or a regulated financial services environment
Project experience across data integrity and/or remediation
Experience partnering with internal risk, technology and data, and operations teams and external providers including the Administrator to ensure data lineage, quality, integrity and risks are understood and embedded into solution designs
RG146 accreditation (or willing to undertake) (desired)
Strong knowledge of superannuation operations and regulatory obligations preferred, with industry qualifications (RG146 or equivalent) highly regarded
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proficiency in data analysis (SQL, Excel, or BI tools) desirable
Solid understanding of systems integration, data flows and operational processes desirable
Excellent skills in stakeholder management and facilitating discussions across various levels of seniority
Collaborative and pragmatic mindset, with the ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues, clients, and key stakeholders
Ability to balance detail-oriented analysis with delivery-focussed project oversight
Ability to work within a self-directed culture and navigate ambiguity
Possess intermediate to advanced level skills, knowledge and experience in the practical application of Microsoft Office applications including but not limited to SQL, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint and Outlook.
A broad understanding of business and information technology including database management.

This role will start as a 12 month fixed term contract with the view to make it permanent thereafter.


The client offers a very flexible workplace, 1-2 days in office per week.

Salary: Excellent day rate on offer; Genuine temp to perm
Ad Text:
ASSIGNMENT:
Genuine temp to perm opportunity. 4-6 month contract engagement to start with.
 
SALARY:
Impressive day rate on offer. Immediate start is preferred.
 
LOCATION:
Sydney - Parramatta Surrounds. Free parking available on-site. You ideally have a drivers license and your own vehicle as the location is not close to public transport.
 
ABOUT THE COMPANY:
We have been exclusively retained by a high growth Australian manufacturer who is a specialist within their industry and are recognised as one of the market leaders in their field.
 
With a prominent brand and instant recognition, they possess over 50 years of experience and have significant presence across NSW. They have built one of the best reputations and brands within the market through their high-quality service offering and genuine focus on customer experience. Through this, they have created an amazing culture of collaboration and true alignment of values evident from their consistently high eNPS and average retention of staff of more than 5+ years.
 
Servicing thousands of customers across the region, this organisation has a strategic vision to double in size over the next 3-5 years.
 
ABOUT THE ROLE:
Reporting to a highly influential CFO, this FP&A Analyst will support the delivery of major finance objectives as the organisation aims to continue its growth journey. The FP&A Analyst will act as a true partner and 2IC to the CFO and Executive Leadership Team to provide ongoing strategic support, change management, transformation and efficiency improvements. The ideal candidate will also be responsible for leading and driving new improvements across reporting, FP&A and best in class processes.
 
As the FP&A Analyst, you will take full ownership for the strategic delivery of business results. The FP&A Analyst has primary day-to-day responsibility for supporting business strategies to add value beyond finance across a broad range of stakeholders and providing leadership to the finance team. The key success factor will be your ability to business partner to deliver key results and improvements.
 
This role not only requires an excellent technical and analytical mind but also someone that can think outside of the box and not be afraid to challenge the status quo.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reporting to the CFO and working in partnership with the senior leadership team, your key responsibilities will include:

Act as a true partner to the Executive Leadership Team to support business strategy and financial direction;
Financial Planning & Analysis – manage and oversee the commercial planning and reporting function including budgeting, forecasting and annual planning process ensuring strategic alignment to business objectives as well as partnering with cross functional leaders across the organisation;
Business Performance Analysis - Provide insights and build business acumen through analysis of data to support commercial decision making;
Commercial management - pro-actively driving risk & opportunity analysis, volume rate mix analysis, contract negotiation, trading terms, financial modelling and business cases;
Assess financial performance across the business to devise and refine key deliverables and KPIs to meet financial objectives;
Spearhead improvements and best practise across finance transformation including new reporting, systems and processes;
Work closely with leadership team on long term strategic business plans;
Be a key project lead for driving continuous improvement initiatives across the finance group.
 
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
You are CA/CPA qualified with a strong passion for business and transformation. You have demonstrated achievements and track record in driving best practise across FP&A, reporting and systems.
 
Overall, you have a vision to fast track your career towards a true leadership role within the next few years by proving yourself in a broad finance role in a fast-growing high performing organisation.
 
You will bring to the role strong commercial acumen, vision for growth, and a passion for best in class processes. You will have a track record of adding value through an absolute understanding of key business drivers; the capacity to drive change; and the ability to influence performance.
 
This is a mid-sized high growth business therefore, you must display the hunger, energy and drive that you are willing to be hands-on, not afraid of a challenge whilst having the gravitas to communicate and influence an impressive Executive Leadership team.
 
Culture fit is key, our client is a privately owned, high growth business. The FP&A Analyst needs to have immediate credibility and be able to earn the trust and confidence of the CFO, COO, CEO, the broader finance team and the executive leadership team. You will demonstrate proven commercial acumen and strategic thinking supported by a high level of competency in finance management. You will have significant experience in working with, advising and/or supporting senior leaders.
 
In addition, you will have:

Solid accounting foundations.
Commercial finance acumen with a proven track record of actively driving commercial agendas across the business.
Experience implementing, delivering and managing new systems and reporting tools.
Intermediate/Advanced excel and modelling skills.
Highly developed written & verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively manage a wide range of key stakeholders.
Pro-active and customer focused mind set.
The ability to work under pressure and manage conflicting priorities.
Key eye for detail and the ability to thrive in a fast paced environment.
Superior stakeholder management, including advanced influencing and negotiation skills.
 
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
This organisation will provide the right analyst the opportunity to build the FP&A pillar for the group and be instrumental in growing the enterprise value for the group. In addition, other key benefits include:

Outstanding opportunity to partner with a prominent CFO, CEO and Executive Leadership team and prove yourself in a highly successful fast growth organisation;
Access to an inspirational leadership team who have been awarded and recognised as some of the best in the industry;
Work for a leader who lives and breathes their purpose and values in everything they do having also been recognised in the industry for top class leadership;
Opportunity to be part of a service consumer category that you will love and be proud about;
Be part of a highly engaged, winning team with a genuine positive culture;
Highly strategic and commercial role with longer term future development pathways;
Own the FP&A finance function providing you with unlimited opportunity to make a difference. The destiny is truly in your hands;
A workplace that's strongly focused on customer experience and on the well-being and happiness of its staff.
 
APPLY:
If you are ready to RECODE your career, please apply clicking the link and send your resume in word format. For a confidential discussion, please reach out to Richard Skaf directly on richard.skaf@recodegroup.com.au.
 
FOLLOW US:
Follow Recode Group on LinkedIn and visit www.recodegroup.com.au for further information and for other interesting job opportunities.

Job Title: Senior Acquisition Analyst - Build to Rent
Category: Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt (Real Estate & Property)
Ad Text:
Mirvac is a brand that creates and curates better experiences. We are more than developers or builders - we are visionaries, and our ability to see the world differently drives us to be bold, embrace innovation and diversity, and lead with optimism.

As creators of positive change, we see each new project as an opportunity to leave a lasting legacy, delivering enduring value for all Australians. We focus on sustainability, innovation, and shared value, to return benefits to our customers, partners, investors, and communities.

Join us as we work towards building the imagine nation.

At Mirvac, we know that it's our people, their passion and expertise and the exceptional experiences we create for our audience, that defines us.

Your opportunity

As the Senior Acquisition Analyst - Build to Rent, you will be reporting to the National Acquisition Manager (BTR) - New Business. Primarily support the Build to Rent New Business team to execute strategy and key deliverables through feasibility and investment modelling and analysis, keeping abreast of market transactions and underwrite assumptions

Your responsibilities will include:

Build and maintain financial models underpinning new business opportunities and investment strategies. This includes building development and investment models, running various scenarios to test different strategies and producing succinct summaries of the results.
Ensure that each financial model is logic and in line with industry practice
Keep abreast of market developments and valuation assumptions and practices.
Drive optimisation of the financial outcomes, assessing options and recommending strategies which underpin value and achieve a "highest and best use" analysis and best-case scenarios.
Perform project level budgeting and forecasting in coordination with the transaction feasibility models.
Understanding of cash and capital impacts of all major decisions and investments.
Ensure modelling is undertaken in a manner consistent with the transaction structure.
Research and analyse demographic, economic, and planning data to support strategic site selection
Prepare competitor analyses and market intelligence reports.
Work collaboratively with the broader Mirvac business particularly development, construction and operations to ensure robust cashflow management and forecasting in place, building an improved focus on cashflow outcomes.
Manage the successful transition and handover of transaction modelling to development, investment and operations as applicable.
Prepare project new business and scenario analysis and conduct ad hoc scenario modelling and analysis where required.
Assist in preparing investment committee papers, presentations and supporting documentation.
Support senior team members in liaising with internal and external stakeholders including capital partners.

Your point of difference

At least 4+ years analytical experience working as an analyst within the property or capital markets industry, preferably within a development or capital transactions environment
Strong financial background
Experience in building, amending and testing of financial models
Experience or knowledge of development and investment with an understanding of relevant accounting principles
Experience in preparing reports and presentations to be delivered to a range of stakeholders
High level communication (written and verbal) and stakeholder management skills
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong financial modelling skills in Excel and comfort with large datasets
Understanding of property valuation methodologies and investment metrics
Strong research, analytical, and report-writing skills
Self-motivated and inquisitive

All of these attributes are preferred, if you think you may be the right fit for the role please still apply

Who is Vivi 

Vivi is the only wireless screen mirroring and digital signage tool designed for education. We help IT help teachers help students with classroom technology that enhances collaboration, control, and creativity.  

Vivi exists because we all had that one teacher who changed our life, who went above and beyond to serve as a role model and sage. They guided discussion, connected with their students on a personal level, were just as engaging and entertaining as they were educational, and they created a dynamic learning environment by constantly involving students.

Those teachers are the masters of the social classroom. Personalised learning environments have been proven to deliver better educational outcomes for individuals through increased participation and engagement. To successfully create such an environment requires a fluid, visual dialogue between teacher and student. This is why Vivi exists. Vivi is used by over 825,000 teachers and students around the world and is setting out to disrupt the enormous education industry with our high-growth, ambitious, and creative team. In this rapidly evolving technology landscape, Vivi is always looking for new ways to disrupt the classroom experience, enhance customer experiences and expand globally.

Opportunity Overview: 

The FP&A Analyst will play a critical role in driving financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and performance analysis across the business. The role works closely with stakeholders across Product, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Operations, Human Resources, and Executive Leadership to turn data into insight—and insight into action.

This is a high-impact role where financial expertise and business acumen will help shape key decisions as we scale our operations and product offerings.

This role is hybrid and is 3 days/week in-office at our South Yarra location. 

What you will do:

Collaborate with department heads to influence commercial decisions and drive profitability

Provide financial guidance on pricing, product launches and go-to-market strategies

Translate complex financial data into clear, actionable insights for non-finance stakeholders

Lead budgeting, modeling, and forecasting across different departments

Deliver monthly reporting packs with variance analysis and executive commentary

Build dynamic financial models to support scenario planning and investment decisions

Analyse key SaaS metrics including ARR, MRR, churn, CAC, LTV, and NRR

Partner with Sales and Marketing to assess campaign ROI and customer acquisition efficiency




What you will need:

You’re not just good with numbers—you’re curious about what they mean. You ask ‘why’ and ‘what if’ to turn data into decisions

CA/CPA qualified

5+ years' experience in FP&A, commercial finance, or business partnering roles

Prior exposure to SaaS, tech, or subscription-based business models highly desirable

Strong financial modelling skills

Demonstrated ability with BI tools and dashboard creation

Exceptional communication skills and ability to present to the Executive Team

Commercial mindset with a passion for data-driven strategy

Vivi is an equal opportunity employer. This means we are committed to recruiting, training, compensating and promoting our employees regardless of Race, Color, Ancestry, National Origin, Religion, Creed, Age, Disability, Sex, Gender, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Gender expression, Medical condition, Genetic Information, Marital status, or Military or Veteran status. As an education technology organization, we are dedicated to reflecting the diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion found in our consumers, employees, and partners. Inclusion is at the heart of what we do, from the way we craft our job descriptions to the values we champion daily.

Must have experience or certification in FinOps
Strong understanding of financial principles and experience working in finance-related roles or environments.
Hybrid working model, supportive and collaborative culture.

 Overview of the role

This is a fantastic time to be joining Suncorp as the industry goes through significant change. As a result, we are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Senior Business Analyst to support the establishment and ongoing operations of our new FinOps Centre of Excellence (CoE). This role will play a key part in driving cloud financial accountability and operational efficiency across the organisation.

You will have the opportunity to join our large Analysis Chapter that supports a variety of medium to large scale programs across the Suncorp Group. The Chapter consists of around 280 like-minded analysts, where ideas and best practice are shared via masterclasses and knowledge sharing. You will support projects being delivered in a continuous delivery model (Agile) and supporting the platform.

Suncorp is proud of our fantastic culture where you will be supported in your career development.

 What you’ll do:

Build strong relationships through engagement with colleagues, and stakeholders across Business and Technology.
Document current and future state processes and identify opportunities for improvement.
Use information gathering techniques to proactively discover requirements and synthesise information accurately, completely, and coherently.
Work collaboratively with delivery teams and business stakeholders to gather, validate and document business requirements and develop recommendations and solutions that meet business and customer needs.
Raise, and support mitigation and resolution of, risks and issues using established tools and frameworks were applicable.
Create detailed user stories (in JIRA) to support delivery.
Mentor/train team members; participate and contribute to business analyst chapter and/or forums providing insights and thought leadership
Suncorp offers a hybrid way of working where you will be expected to be in the office approx. 2 days per week.

 

What you’ll bring:

FinOps Knowledge: Experience or certification in FinOps practices is highly desirable
Cloud & Container Technologies: Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and/or containerisation technologies
Financial Acumen: Strong understanding of financial principles and experience working in finance-related roles or environments.
Minimum 5 years Business Analysis experience in a project/delivery orientated role, from a large organisation.
Minimum 3 years’ Agile, Lean and waterfall experience including knowledge of Agile practices, workshops, and Agile ceremonies facilitation.
Must be able to translate and understand business and technical requirements and provide appropriate alternatives and solutions to meet those requirements.
Strong stakeholder engagement, relationship management and influencing skills including experience in dealing with various stakeholders.
Strong team player with a positive attitude, willingness to learn and desire to make a difference.
Must be able to manage multiple complex initiatives with competing deadlines.

 

What we can offer you:

Discounts and offers on a range of retail favourite stores as well as insurance products.
A range of flexible working and leave options, including 20 weeks paid parental leave, 4 weeks paid secondary carer parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave.
Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs.
Give back to our communities with payroll giving, donation matching and paid volunteer leave.

About Suncorp:

For over 100 years Suncorp has been driven by our guiding Purpose – to build futures and protect what matters. To ensure we deliver on that Purpose, we’ve made a commitment, built on trust, empowerment, and flexibility – to help our people unlock their full potential and unleash their best and brightest selves. With the backing and support of some of the most trusted names in insurance, the Suncorp family provides our people with every opportunity to grow their career as they make a meaningful difference for our customers and our communities. We’re excited about what we can achieve together, working every day to be better, do more and realise the future we want to see just beyond the horizon.

 

If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for, please apply online today. Applications sent directly via email will not be accepted.

 

Employee benefits | Suncorp Group

At Suncorp we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating a diverse, accessible, and inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.

If you require any support and adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process or in the workplace, we encourage you to contact melissa.turkington@suncorp.com.au for a confidential conversation.
